headline.main: University Hires Monitor for Police Reform After Fatal Stop
headline.print_headline: University Hires Monitor for Police Reform After Fatal Stop

docs.snippet: The University of Cincinnati has hired an outside monitor to oversee reform of its police department after the fatal 2015 shooting of an unarmed black motorist by one of its police officers....
docs.lead_paragraph: The University of Cincinnati has hired an outside monitor to oversee reform of its police department after the fatal 2015 shooting of an unarmed black motorist by one of its police officers.

docs.snippet: The National Museum of Women in the Arts calls for “needed change in museum leadership.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: The National Museum of Women in the Arts calls for “needed change in museum leadership.”

headline.main: U.N. Condemns Killings, Calls for Better Access to Palestinian Camp in Syria
headline.print_headline: U.N. Condemns Killings, Calls for Better Access to Palestinian Camp in Syria

docs.snippet: The United Nations on Friday condemned the killing of four people as they tried to leave a Palestinian refugee camp near the Syrian capital and said tightened security around the camp meant residents face "grave risks" when trying to access aid....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations on Friday condemned the killing of four people as they tried to leave a Palestinian refugee camp near the Syrian capital and said tightened security around the camp meant residents face "grave risks" when trying to access aid.

headline.main: Turkey Pounds Syrian Kurdish Fighters as Both Sides Try to Fight IS
headline.print_headline: Turkey Pounds Syrian Kurdish Fighters as Both Sides Try to Fight IS

docs.snippet: At least 90 Turkish rockets pounded a group of Kurdish fighters allied to a U.S.-backed militia in northern Syria on Friday, as clashes intensified between two sides both supposed to be fighting Islamic State, a monitor and militia spokesperson sa...
docs.lead_paragraph: At least 90 Turkish rockets pounded a group of Kurdish fighters allied to a U.S.-backed militia in northern Syria on Friday, as clashes intensified between two sides both supposed to be fighting Islamic State, a monitor and militia spokesperson said.

headline.main: Short-Handed Supreme Court Delays Action in 3 Cases
headline.print_headline: Short-Handed Supreme Court Delays Action in 3 Cases

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court is offering new evidence that the short-handed court is having trouble getting its work done....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court is offering new evidence that the short-handed court is having trouble getting its work done.

headline.main: Overloaded Train Derails in Cameroon, Killing at Least 53
headline.print_headline: Overloaded Train Derails in Cameroon, Killing at Least 53

docs.snippet: An overloaded train derailed along the route that links Cameroon's two major cities on Friday, killing at least 53 people and injuring more than 300, the government said....
docs.lead_paragraph: An overloaded train derailed along the route that links Cameroon's two major cities on Friday, killing at least 53 people and injuring more than 300, the government said.

headline.main: Giant Pages From Ancient Quran on Display in Washington, DC
headline.print_headline: Giant Pages From Ancient Quran on Display in Washington, DC

docs.snippet: Books come in all sizes, but one 15th century Quran was so enormous, it's said that a wheelbarrow was needed to carry it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Books come in all sizes, but one 15th century Quran was so enormous, it's said that a wheelbarrow was needed to carry it.

headline.main: Student in Debunked Rolling Stone Rape Story Got Tattoo to Mark Attack
headline.print_headline: Student in Debunked Rolling Stone Rape Story Got Tattoo to Mark Attack

docs.snippet: The University of Virginia student who fabricated a gang rape story published in Rolling Stone got a tattoo to commemorate the supposed assault and her ability to overcome it, the story's reporter testified on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The University of Virginia student who fabricated a gang rape story published in Rolling Stone got a tattoo to commemorate the supposed assault and her ability to overcome it, the story's reporter testified on Friday.

headline.main: AT&T Aims for an Empire in Merger Talks With Time Warner
headline.print_headline: AT&T Aims for an Empire With Time Warner

docs.snippet: A deal would give the giant TV distributor and internet provider a collection of programming like HBO and movies like “Suicide Squad.”...

byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced and Cecilia Kang contributed reporting.
byline.original: By LESLIE PICKER, ANDREW ROSS SORKIN and EMILY STEEL

docs.lead_paragraph: A deal would give the giant TV distributor and internet provider a collection of programming like HBO and movies like “Suicide Squad.”

headline.main: N.F.L. Stadium in Las Vegas May Be an Ego Boost, but Not an Economic One
headline.print_headline: Las Vegas Stadium May Bolster Egos, but Not Economy

docs.snippet: Rarely has the economic rationale for a taxpayer-funded stadium been as flimsy as it is in Las Vegas’s case — and never has the subsidy been as high....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rarely has the economic rationale for a taxpayer-funded stadium been as flimsy as it is in Las Vegas’s case — and never has the subsidy been as high.
